page.title: 04PETT LEVEL RESCUE BOAT I
page.content: Pett Level runs a totally-voluntary inshore{rescue boat.} It was funded at the New Beach Club in 1970 and is now a registered charity. Annual maintenance is Â£4000. Friends of Pett Level Rescue Boat help by paying an annual membership fee. Each year a money-raising Open Day is held at the {'Smuggler' Pub.} Now they have an Avon Searider boat with a 50 HP mercury engine, a Landrover and launch vehicle, a boathouse and ramp constructed by crew members. The boat is on constant call. Emergency calls increase each year. They assist the R.N.L.I. flank stations at Rye and Hastings. Exercises are held with R.A.F., R.N.L.I. and Coastguard.
